bibl.title: The Aeschylean Tetralogy: Attested and Conjectured Groups.
bibl.note: Suite de: Idem, The Aeschylean Tetralogy: Prolegomena, CJ 74 (1979) pp. 289-304. - The tetralogy is a form typical of Aeschylos' dramatic thought, and perhaps peculiarly suited to what he wished to express. La part des papyrus est importante.
Gantz Timothy N., The Aeschylean Tetralogy: Attested and Conjectured Groups.
